job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: pIf you are a Colorado resident and this role is a fieldbased or remote role you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role which we will provide upon request  You may contact 8883677223 option 5 for assistancebrbrstrongIn this role you have the opportunity tostrongppspanApply scientific principles to healthcare problems by analyzing complex data sets You will create visualizations and develop models to drive data insights and scale algorithms The data scientist will work with cutting edge cloudbased services and machine learning algorithms to modernize the way AI is deployed in healthcare In partnership spanspanspanwith scientistsspanspanspan physicians engineers cloud partners and business owners you will work backwards from business objectives to drive scalable machine learning solutions and pull through the appropriate technology as needed You will be a technical leader influencing the analyses and promoting best practices within the team You should be passionate about working with data relentless in focus on quality have a solution mindset and focused to answer key healthcare challengesbrbrspanstrongYou are responsible forbrstrongpullispanDelivering an innovative ML solution from beginning to end including understanding the business need aggregating data exploring data building amp validating predictive models deploying and monitoring completed models to the organizationspanlilispanUse AWS AI services eg AWS Glue ML platforms SageMaker and frameworks eg TensorFlow PyTorch SparkML scikitlearn to aggregate data and traindeploy ML modelsspanlilispanHave a keen ability to analyze extract normalize understand and label relevant healthcare dataspanlilispanResearch and implement novel ML approachesspan to accelerate interoperability knowledge extraction enterprise search realtime workflow orchestration and morelilispanWork with our cloudpartners to identify modern cloudbased services that can accelerated Philips ability to aggregate date as well as train and operationalize ML modelsbrbrspanliulstrongYou are a part of strongpjoin an innovation team focused on developing machine learning solutions for healthcare The team is committed to developing production quality artificial intelligence AI algorithms that turn hospitals big data into meaningful insights Youll be joining a world leading healthcare company thats committed to innovation and substantiable business practices This is your opportunity to help Philips make a global impact in healthcare and achieve our commitment towards improving the lives of 3B people by the year 2030brbrstrongTo succeed in this role you should have the following skills and experiencebrstrongpulliMasters Degree with research and development experience in Statistics Engineering Computer Science Physics Applied Math Operations Research or a related fieldlili3 years solving business problems using Machine Learning with measurable impactlilispanPrior experience in a machine learning or data scientist role building and deploying ML models spanlilispanHands on experience developing deep learning and other machine learning models spanspaneg natural language processing computer vision statistical learning theory graph modelsspanlilispanExperience writing code in Python R Scala Java C including documentation for reproducibilityspanliliFamiliarity with on premise GPU clusters andor cloud computing services AWS Google Cloud Azure for training and deploying deep learning modelslilispanExperience handling terabyte size datasets diving into data to discover hidden patterns using data visualization tools andor SQLspanlilispanExperience writing and speaking about technical concepts to business technical and lay audiences spanliliSolution driven mindset with demonstrated analytic and independent problemsolving skills through delivering solutions to customers peerreviewed publications and conference presentationsbrliulPrefered QUALIFICATIONSbrulliPhD in a highly quantitative fieldlilispanExperience using AWS services to aggregate data as well as train deploy monitor optimize modelsspanlilispanDemonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity prioritizing needs and delivering results in a dynamic business environmentspanliliDemonstrated successful experience working in a hospital environmentliliKnowledge of clinical workflow and healthcare operations developed through experience working in a clinical environmentliliExperience with health care systems data and communication standards PACS EMREHR RIS IHE HL7 DICOM etcliliFamiliarity in the use of controlled clinical terminologies and ontologies UMLS SNOMED ICD CPT etcliliStrong ability to take ownership and work independentlybrbrliulstrongIn return we offer youstrongpThe Opportunity to sharpen your talents with new challenges in our dynamic organization As a marketdriven company we are used to listening to our customers amp apply the same thinking to our employees We offer a competitive salary outstanding benefits and flexibility in a career with a positive and supportive atmosphere in which to develop your talents furtherbrbrUS work authorization is a precondition of employment The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a workauthorized visabrbrCompany relocation benefits will not be provided for this position Candidates need to live within the territory strongemoremstrong within commuting distance to Cambridge MA brbrstrongWhy should you join PhilipsstrongppWorking at Philips is more than a job Its a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways Learn more by watching this videobrbrTo find out more about what its like working for Philips at a personal level visit the Working at Philips page on our career website where you can read stories from our employee blog
